questions.text: A 28-year primigravida with 12 weeks of gestation undergoes CBC which is as follows: Hb 10.5, MCH 25, MCV65, RBC count 5.5 million/cu.mm, Retic count 1.8%, Serum iron 150micrograms/dL, serum ferritin 120micrograms/L. which of the following constitutes proper management of this lady?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Immediate HPLC. 

The patients HB (10.5) Is disproportionate to RBC (5.5) thus do Mentzer index in such cases. MI=MCV/RBC count= 65/5.5 value will be less than 13 thus we are suspecting thalassemia minor so do HPLC.

questions.text:
Which of the following statements are true?

I. SDP donors can donate after a gap of 2 days

II. Platelet transfusion is contraindicated in ITP

III. Steroids are one of treatment of TTP

IV. Platelets stored at 4 degree have a shelf life of 5 days with agitation

V. ABO is mandatory for cryoprecipitate
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A) 

Platelets store d at 20-24 degree have shelf life of 5 days, for cryoprecipitate ABO RH cross matching all are not done.

questions.text: A 35-year male presents with left calf pain & edema, easy fatigue. General examination shows petechiae all over body. Urine output is reduced, and examination shows presence of hemoglobin. CBC shows Hb 9g/dL, platelet count 40000, TLC 4000. Which of the following investigations will help in arriving at diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D) 

Flow cytometry

Hemoglobinuria, with thrombocytopenia and thrombosis (calf pain and edema in leg) is suggestive of paraoxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria, Flow cytometry is gold standard for diagnosis of PNH (CD55 and CD 59 should be
negative in PNH)

questions.text:
A 65-year male presents with weight loss and fever for last three weeks. Further history suggests he has lost appetite. Imaging showed mass in stomach with various perigastric lymphnodes involved. Immunohistochemistry of the cells were positive for CD45, CD20, CD22, CD10, CD23. Ki 67 index was 80%. Which of the following is likely treatment of this
case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B) 

R-CHOP. 

The patient is having a gastric lymphoma which is high-grade ( B
symptoms and Ki67 is 80%) and CD 20 positive suggestive of a B cell lymphoma high
grade treatment is chemo, R-CHOP is one commonly used regimen for this.

choices.text: Acute myeloid leukaemia, all transretinoic acid

questions.text:
A 38-year male presents with fever and easy fatigue for last three weeks, examination showed patichae purpura. CBC shows Hb 8g/dL, platelet count 35000, TLC 2500. Bone marrow aspirate is hyper cellular with dysplasia in myeloid cells, blast count is 10%. Cytogenetics of blasts shows t(15;17). What is the likely diagnosis and treatment of this
patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D) 

Acute myeloid leukaemia, all transretinoic acid. 

Thee blllsscay(15;17) hat is the key word for diagnosis of AML. Blast having t(8;21) or (15;17) or inversion (16) are called as AML irrespective of cooun

questions.text: A patient presents with periorbital edema. Urine examination shows Albumin 3+ and occasional RBC casts. Renal biopsy was performed and is as shown in the image below. What is likely cause leading to this?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B) 

Hepatitis B. 

The biopsy shows a silver stain of kidney showing tram track appearance seen in MPGN, amongst the given option Hepatitis B causes MPGN. Other causes are cryogloinuria, SLE, schistosoma, CLL/SLL, HIVand Alpha1 antitrypsin deficiency.

questions.text: Histological examination from a patient with thyroid swelling and history of hypertension is as follows, the arrow marks pointed represent?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B) 

Amyloid

Thyroid mass shhing pink material cannn be medullary carcinoma of thyroid

questions.text: Which of the following diseases will have a dimorphic anemia due to iron and folic acid deficiency?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A) 

Celiac disease 

Option B causes iron deficiency anemia, option C causes B12 and Iron deficiency, option D causes B12 deficiency

questions.text: Histological examination of a colonic polyp in a 50 year is as seen in the image, what is likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B) 

Tubular adenoma

Penduculated polyp is seen in histology (option C,D are sessile) the polyp contains dilated and branched gland seen in in adenomatous polyp. Option A will show arborising pattern of smooth muscle and connective tissue.

choices.text: Decreased IgG production in this child
Child can be associated with IgA deficiency

questions.text: A child presents with anemia and jaundice. Peripheral blood smear is as shown below. After diagnosing the condition, the child was asked to get immunised against Pneumococcus. What is the reasoning behind the same.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A) 

The patient is having sickle cell anemia, which progresses to autosplenectomy leading to decreased IgG. IgG is important opsonin required for clearing of capsulated organisms.

questions.text: A non-smoker patient presented with persistent cough with sputum for last two years. Imaging of lung shows a small 20 mm coin lesion in bronchus. Histological examination is as shown in the image. Which of the following changes are seen in this lesion?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B) 

Hamartoma. 

Histology shows pseudostratified squamous epithelium with under lying adipose tissue, spindle cells suggesting a abnormal organisation of cells.

questions.text:
True statements amongst the following are?

I. Huntington Chorea is more severe when it is transmitted from father to children.

II. Angelman syndrome and mitochondrial diseases transmit only from mother to children.

III. Telomerase is a RNA dependent RNA polymerase

IV. Humans have three types of chromosomes

V. Noncoding DNA can synthesise RNA
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B) 

Telomerase is a RNA dependent DNA polymerase. Humans have only three sets of chromosome (meta, Submeta and Acrocentric)

questions.text: A child had an episode of severe diarrhoea, followed by anuria. Biopsy from kidney is as shown below. Which of the following is likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C) 

Acute tubular necrosis. 

History of diarrhoea and Anuria and histology shows cells without nuclei (Karyolysis) seen in coagulative necrosis.

questions.text: Function of platelet is indicated by which of the following in a thromboelastography?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D) 

MA 

Maximum Amplitude measures platelet count and function.

questions.text: A 15-year-old presents with hematuria, after a respiratory tract infection, serum IgA is elevated. Urine examination shows RBC casts. Which of the following is most likely pathogenesis explaining the disease?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A) 

Insitu immune complex

The patient is having isolated hematuria after respiratory tract infection with elevated IgA is suggestive o IgA nephropathy
